series.chardesc:
Carlo is a 7th grader. Most often, he keeps his cool and goes with the flow. Carlo’s friends would describe him as pretty happy, easy going and the calm one of the bunch. When it comes to feelings, Carlo is usually in the green zone.

Max is a 7th grader. He knows how to be a great friend. Max feels deeply and his friends like that he always has their back when they feel down in the dumps. Max is good at listening and showing empathy. When Max gets sad or disappointed he feels it greatly and isn’t afraid to cry or show he’s feeling blue.

Lucy is a 7th grader. She’s known for having a lot of energy. Lucy is peppy, upbeat and loves to have fun. Her friends like her positive energy and sometimes think she’s shines brightly like a bolt of lightening.

Anna is a 7th grader. She has a lot of confidence and knows how to assert herself. Her friends admire how she stands up for herself and others. Sometimes she can get fiery and her temper flares, but she likes to be bold.

scenes.name: Emotion Zones: A Rainbow Of Feelings
scenes.application:
It’s the 7th grade lunch hour. Classmates are talking about getting their science test results after lunch. It’s sort of a big deal because kids who did well will be rewarded with a trip to the planetarium. Kids who scored low will have to stay back at school and do a special project. Students are buzzing with predictions on how they did.

Carlo, Max, Lucy, and Anna all have different feelings about how they think they did as they talk about getting their test results back.

Carlo is feeling calm and cool like a zen green garden. Max, feels sad like he’s blue. Lucy is excited and is bright like a yellow sun. Anna is angry like a red burning fire.

Carlo is a 7th grader. Most often he keeps his cool and goes with the flow. Carlo’s friends would describe him as pretty happy, easy going and the calm one of the bunch. When it comes to feelings Carlo is usually in the green zone.

Max is a 7th grader. He knows how to be a great friend. Max feels deeply and his friends like that he always has their back when they feel down in the dumps. Max is good at listening and showing empathy. When Max gets sad or disappointed you’ll find him inthe blue zone. He feels it greatly and isn’t afraid to cry or show he’s feeling blue.

Lucy is a 7th grader. She’s known for having a lot of energy. Lucy is peppy, upbeat, and loves to have fun. Her friends like her positive energy. With all of her excitement she brings you’ll probably see her in the yellow zone.

scenes.name: Feelings In Actions
scenes.application:
Did you notice how Carlo, Max, Lucy, and Anna matched colors to their feelings? The colors and feelings they identified are called emotion zones.

Zones help us identify our emotions clearly because sometimes it's difficult to see how we feel.

What different emotions did you have today?

Can you assign a color to all of them? What actions did you do in each zone?

If you’re in the blue zone maybe you cried, moped, or hung your head down.

If you were in the green zone maybe you smiled, sat calmly, or acted peacefully.

If you were in the yellow zone maybe you jumped around, moved fast or your heart raced.

If you were red zone maybe you stomped, punched, or screamed.

Now go back to the feelings you had today. Can see the colors you felt and the actions you showed?

scenes.name: Chaotic classroom
scenes.rptitle: Dysregulation:  Out of control and off balance

kc.question: If you have a dysregulated mind what might that look or sound like?

options.nugget: If you’re dysregulated you probably won’t be calm
If you’re dysregulated you might feel like yelling
If you’re dysregulated you might shut down and not want to talk.  Keeping quiet can also mean you feel regulated.

kc.question: If you have a dysregulated body what might that look or sound like?

options.option: If you are feeling dysregulated with your body it might look like dancing around
options.nugget: Dancing can be a regulated response but also get dysregulated

options.option: If you are feeling dysregulated with your body it might look like hitting something
options.nugget: When you’re dysregulated your anger may make you hit something

options.option: If you are feeling dysregulated with your body it might sound like clapping and cheering
options.nugget: If you’re dysregulated you probably won’t happy actions.

kc.question: If you have dysregulated emotions what might that look or sound like?

options.option: If you are feeling dysregulated with your emotions it might look like turning red with anger
options.nugget: If you’re dysregulated you might feel like you’re burning up with anger

options.option: If you are feeling dysregulated with your emotions it might sound like laughing
options.nugget: Laughter can be a dysregulated nervous response or a regulated happy response

options.option: If you are feeling dysregulated with your emotions it might look like giving hugs
options.nugget: Usually if you’re dysregulated you won’t feel like showing affection

scenes.name: Regaining Control
scenes.application:
What does it take to have regulation?

To have balance and be in control of your mind it needs:

Positive thoughts

Thinking strategies

Problem-solving skills

Confidence

To have balance and be in control of your body it needs:

Food

Sleep or rest

Movement

Relaxation

Take care of sensory needs

To have balance and be in control of your emotions it needs:

Calming skills

Support from family or friends

Talking about feelings

We are all capable of having emotional regulation, but it’s also something we need to work on every day because our emotions can change. To help you make it become more of a habit select one key action from the mind, body, and emotions areas and try doing it for a day. Write down what you will do. At the end of the day rate our see if you felt more balance and control.

scenes.name: Try it out yourself!
scenes.rptitle: Scene with a life application exercise

kc.question: What color zones do you find yourself in when you’re dysregulated?  Click all that apply
To get to the green zone what do you think would help you the most?  Click all that apply.

options.option: Take a deep breath and think a positive thought
Take a break and move around to burn off energy
Find a friend or adult to talk about how you’re feeling

kc.question: Write down 3 things you will try for the next week.
